text.div:
Id: DT.IMMZ.D2.DT.DTP.Pregnancystartingwith4doses
Url: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Version: 0.2.0
Title: Decision Table Determine required vaccinations
Status: draft
Date: 2025-07-17 20:56:23+0000
Publisher: WHO
Description:

Determine required vaccinations
Knowledge Capability: computable
Related Artifacts:

References

  • WHO recommendations for routine immunization – summary tables (March 2023) (1) Tetanus vaccines: WHO position paper (February 2017) (7)
Libraries:
DTs.DTP
Actions:
Client is due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose: Client is due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose "Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" (where "Vaccine type" = "Tetanus and diphtheria-containing vaccines") Pregnant women who received 4 tetanus-containing vaccines doses during childhood or pre-adulthood need only 1 booster dose, which should be given at the first opportunity. To provide lifelong protection, a sixth dose would be needed at least 1 year after the fifth dose, or during the next pregnancy. From 7 years of age, only tetanus toxoid with reduced diphtheria toxoid (Td) combinations should be used. Age-appropriate combinations-containing pertussis vaccine with reduced diphtheria toxoid are also available. Only acellular pertussis (aP)-containing vaccines should be used for vaccination of persons aged 7 years and older.
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose
Dynamic Values:
status: (draft)
intent: (proposal)
Health worker guidance: Communicate guidance to the health worker
Then: Definition: http://smart.who.int/base/ActivityDefinition/SGDecisionTableGuidance

status: (active)
payload.contentString: (Should vaccinate client with second tetanus and diphtheria booster dose as three DTP primary series doses and one tetanus and diphtheria booster dose were administered and client is currently pregnant. Check for contraindications.)

priority: (Code { system: 'http://hl7.org/fhir/request-priority', code: 'routine' })
Client is not due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose: Client is not due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose "Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" (where "Vaccine type" = "Tetanus and diphtheria-containing vaccines")
Then: Definition: Decision Table Output Client is not due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose

payload.contentString: (Should not vaccinate client with third tetanus and diphtheria booster dose as the latest tetanus and booster dose was administered less than 1 year ago. This dose should be administered at least 1 year after second booster dose or during next pregnancy. Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for third tetanus and diphtheria booster dose.)

action.title: Client is due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose
action.description:
Client is due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Due" (where "Vaccine type" = "Tetanus and diphtheria-containing vaccines")

Pregnant women who received 4 tetanus-containing vaccines doses during childhood or pre-adulthood need only 1 booster dose, which should be given at the first opportunity. To provide lifelong protection, a sixth dose would be needed at least 1 year after the fifth dose, or during the next pregnancy.

From 7 years of age, only tetanus toxoid with reduced diphtheria toxoid (Td) combinations should be used. Age-appropriate combinations-containing pertussis vaccine with reduced diphtheria toxoid are also available. Only acellular pertussis (aP)-containing vaccines should be used for vaccination of persons aged 7 years and older.

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should vaccinate client with second tetanus and diphtheria booster dose as three DTP primary series doses and one tetanus and diphtheria booster dose were administered and client is currently pregnant. 
Check for contraindications.

action.title: Client is not due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose
action.description:
Client is not due for tetanus and diphtheria booster dose
"Immunization recommendation status" = "Not due" (where "Vaccine type" = "Tetanus and diphtheria-containing vaccines")

action.title: Health worker guidance
action.description: Communicate guidance to the health worker

expression.expression:
Should not vaccinate client with third tetanus and diphtheria booster dose as the latest tetanus and booster dose was administered less than 1 year ago. This dose should be administered at least 1 year after second booster dose or during next pregnancy. 
Check for any other vaccines due and inform the caregiver of when to come back for third tetanus and diphtheria booster dose.
